      • checkSelection

        public static <T> java.util.Collection<T> checkSelection(java.util.Collection<T> allowed,

        Same as checkSelection but not supporting an empty collection for the allowed elements.
        See Also:
        checkSelection(Collection, Collection, boolean)

      • checkSelection

        public static <T> java.util.Collection<T> checkSelection(java.util.Collection<T> allowed,
                                         java.util.Collection<T> selection,
                                         boolean isEmptyAllowedSupported)
        Used for query filter semantics with collections.
        Given a collection with the selected elements and another one with the allowed elements:
        If the allowed elements are empty (and empty for the allowed is not supported) it throws a PermissionDeniedException. Else, if elements is empty, then allowed is returned. Otherwise, the selected elements must be contained in the allowed collection.

      • find

        public static <T extends java.lang.Enum<T>> Permission find(Permission perm,
                                            java.lang.Class<T> enumType)
        Finds (by name) the specified permission as a valid value in the permission enum.
        Returns:
        the permission if found otherwise null.

        Parameters:
        groupNature - the group's nature
        Returns:
        a collection of permissions having a relationship to its possible values according to the specified group's nature
